page.title: 08Historical Interest
page.content: {Fulford Hall}was built in 1875 owned by the Johnson family.Sir William Bowater,Lord Mayor of Birmingham lived there in the 1930's.In the 1950's it was split up into two houses.Today it is being sold, plans have been submitted to convert it to an Old People's Home. {A Memorial Stone}was erected where J. Johnson fell from his horse and was killed. {Manor Farm House}(Rumbush Lane)-The foundations of the original farmhouse are Anglo-Saxon. The remainder of the house is sixteenth century containing the original oak beams and panelling. It is a "listed building". In the lounge there is an original "Priest's Hole".
